alert.note: Alert for Morgan (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 14 at 3:56PM MDT until June 17 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Colorado... South Platte River at Fort Morgan affecting Morgan County. South Platte River near Weldona affecting Morgan and Weld Counties. South Platte River near Kersey affecting Weld County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...South Platte River at Fort Morgan. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, The lowest areas along the river begin to flood. At 17.5 feet, There is minor flooding of agricultural land along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM MDT Wednesday the stage was 15.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady then rise to a crest of 16.5 feet Thursday morning. The river will remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood stage is 17.5 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
